item.name: qnapfirmwarebuild
item.description: Calculate the firmware build based on the qnapinfo item which runs the NMap check. This makes writing triggers easier and reduces logic and trigger complexity.

item.name: Sudo version
item.description: Sudo CVE 2017-100?? no patch yet so no trigger can be written

item.name: phpmailer package version
item.description: https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2016/CVE-2016-10033.html and https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2016/CVE-2016-10045.html as first fix was a regression.

item.name: CVE-2020-0796 LAN Scan
item.description:
Remember to set the {$LANSUBNET} macro to something other than 169.254..0.0
Scan will run once per hour, alerting if vulnerable machines are found.

item.name: exim packages installed
item.description: Collect list of installed exim packages (if any) Relates to this: https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2019/CVE-2019-15846.html and 4.69 once I find the link.

item.name: Kernel Release
item.description: NB: As of 2017-01-04 this does not work due to https://support.zabbix.com/browse/ZBXNEXT-2580 but it's here so that when Zabbix fix upstream, this and DirtyCOW checks will kick in.

item.name: OpenSSL Package
item.description:
There's just so many CVEs. Heatbleed, POODLE, ROP Gadgets, so just create new triggers for each version to avoid flubbing the checks and add the CVE list in that description instead.
Bob Beck was right you know...

item.name: windows build number
item.description: Get the windows build number, e.g. 1903, 1909, etc.

item.name: Bash Package Version
item.description: get the package version of bash too

item.name: Imagemagick package version
item.description: https://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-2990-1/ returning anything below versions on that page will make it vulnerable to CVE-2016-3714, CVE-2016-3715, CVE-2016-3716, CVE-2016-3717, CVE-2016-3718 and CVE-2016-5118

item.name: Samba Package
item.description: Samba does have CVEs and this specifically notes CVE-2017-7494 as being a problem per https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2017/CVE-2017-7494.html

item.name: Beep
item.description: Check if Beep is installed on computer, beep is insecure https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=894667

item.name: CVE-2020-0796.py Script
item.description:
cve2020-0796.py can be found at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/knightmare2600/SMBGhost/master/scanner.py
self contained, and takes one variable, which is an IP or CIDR mask, e.g.
scanner.py 192.168.123.0/24. Suggest this script urns from an on-site zabbix proxy

item.name: exim-base package
item.description: exim-base package is used by exim-daemon-light and exim-deamon-heavy packages.

item.name: libphp-phpmailer package
item.description: Check if Beep is installed on computer, beep is insecure https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2016/CVE-2016-10045.html and https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2016/CVE-2016-10033.html

item.name: zabbix-proxy-* package
item.description: Check database agonstic file to confirm there is a zabbix proxy running. This will be used to checks such as the CVE2020-0796 check

item.name: NMap QNAP Script
item.description:
check if NMap script for QNAP info exists. This lives here since the QNAP SNMP Template exists to identify device via SNMP only. NOT check security of builds.
Also no Zabbix Agent exists for QNAP NAS devices as of 2017-06-14

httptest.name: QNAP Build Number 20140927 (ShellShock)
httptest.agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:33.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/33.0

httptest.name: QNAP Build Number 20170516 (Auth Bypass)
httptest.agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:33.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/33.0

httptest.name: QNAP Build Number 20170606 (SambaCRY)
httptest.agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:33.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/33.0

trigger.name: Bash version vulnerable to CVE-2014-6271 (ShellShock)
trigger.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shellshock_(software_bug) CVE-2014-6277, CVE-2014-6278, CVE-2014-7169, CVE-2014-7186, and CVE-2014-7187

trigger.name: Hey! LANSUBNET macro is set to the default value 169.254.0.0/24 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
This is a good indication that the global macro value has not been changed in the per node setting. Remember to add it on a per node (usually proxy) basis.
For example, if the local subnet was 192.168.100.0/24 set it to that.

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has Beep package installed (CVE-2018-04-92)
trigger.description: Beep has security vulnerability https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=894667

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts/cve2020-0796.py].last()}=0 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/share/man/man8/zabbix_proxy.8.gz].last()}=1
trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts/cve2020-0796.py installed
trigger.description: If the CVE2020-0796 exploit checking python script is not installed, alert ot this fact. but only for zabbix proxies. A copy can be found at: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/knightmare2600/SMBGhost/master/cve2020-0796.py

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no /usr/share/nmap/scripts/http-qnap-nas-info.nse file installed
trigger.description: if the NMAP package does not unclude the QNAP checking script, we cannot, therefore, check the QNAP build

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/share/doc/python-netaddr/copyright].last()}=0 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/share/man/man8/zabbix_proxy.8.gz].last()}=1
trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no python-netaddr package installed
trigger.description: Dependency package of the CVE script. Run apt install python-netaddr to resolve. But only for zabbix proxies

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run["sudo -V |head -n 1"].str(1.8.9p5)}<>1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run["sudo -V |head -n 1"].str(1.8.16)}<>1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run["sudo -V |head -n 1"].str(1.8.21p2)}<>1
trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} vulnerable to CVE 2019-14287 (sudo auth bypass)
trigger.description:
PoC: https://thehackernews.com/2019/10/linux-sudo-run-as-root-flaw.html
Patches: https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2019/CVE-2019-14287.html
I'm not supporting 14.04 Migrate already!

trigger.name: Host MAcro $LANSUBNET set to default value 169.254.0.0/24 please update!
trigger.description:
To correct this, go into Zabbix UI > Configuration > Hosts and update the amcro per host.
DO NOT change the global macro, as this will break the check on other subnets/proxies.

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[/usr/bin/python /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts/cve2020-0796.py {$LANSUBNET}].str(Vulnerable!)}=1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[Reg Query "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion" /v ReleaseId].str(1903)}=1 or {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[/usr/bin/python /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts/cve2020-0796.py {$LANSUBNET}].str(Vulnerable!)}=1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[Reg Query "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion" /v ReleaseId].str(1910)}=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} reports machines vulnerable to CVE-2020-0796
trigger.description:
To mitigate, installed KB4551762 or run the Powershell command to disable SMBv3 compression. More information cna be found at:
https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-0796 and https://support.microsoft.com/help/4551762
TODO: Need the build number for a ptached 1903 machines with an or added in

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:web.test.rspcode[QNAP Build Number 20170606 (SambaCRY),QNAP Build].last(0)}=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} {NAS} Vulnerable to SambaCRY
trigger.description: Confirm if build number matches SambaCRY build and alert on that basis. You are doing this inverse logic becuase newer builds do NOT match, but DO contain the fix.

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Outdated QNAP firmware
trigger.description: Original Template had: (({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-2.)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-4.1.13-19.31)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-3.13.0-76.120)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-3.[0-7]$)})=0)

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} vulnerable to CVE-20XX-XXXXX (TODO)
trigger.description: /bin/bash file time is prior to ShellShock fix release date then it is vulnerable to CVE-2014-6277, CVE-2014-6278, CVE-2014-7169, CVE-2014-7186, and CVE-2014-7187 (Shellshock)

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2014-3566 (POODLE)
trigger.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/POODLE This check is for POODLE only. Heartbleed and Cthulhu can go live in another trigger.

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} vulnerable to CVE-2015-0235 (GHOST)
trigger.description:
https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-protect-your-linux-server-against-the-ghost-vulnerability
versions 2.15-0ubuntu10.10, 2.11.1-0ubuntu7.20 and 2.13-38+deb7u7 are NOT vulnerable per Digital Ocean's link.

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2016-0728 (Kernel Keyring)
trigger.description: Original Template had: (({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-2.)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-4.1.13-19.31)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-3.13.0-76.120)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-3.[0-7]$)})=0)

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[openssl version].str(1.0.1q)}=1 or {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[openssl version].str(1.0.2e)}=1
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2016-0800 (DROWN)
trigger.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DROWN This check is for DROWN only. Heartbleed and Cthulhu can go live in another trigger.

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2016-2183 (SWEET32)
trigger.description: https://bobcares.com/blog/how-to-fix-sweet32-birthday-attacks-vulnerability-cve-2016-2183/ SWEET32 also needs a check written for SSL etc.

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2016-5195 (DirtyCOW)
trigger.description:
Original Template had: (({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-2.)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-4.1.13-19.31)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-3.13.0-76.120)})=0 and ({cve-2016-0728:system.sw.packages["^kernel",,short].regexp(kernel-3.[0-7]$)})=0)
https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-protect-your-server-against-the-dirty-cow-linux-vulnerability

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/share/doc/libphp-phpmailer/copyright].last(0)}=1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[/usr/bin/dpkg --list | /bin/grep phpmail].str(5.2.14+dfsg)}=0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2016-10033 & CVE-2016-10045 (libphp-phpmailer RCE)
trigger.description:
https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2016/CVE-2016-10033.html and https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2016/CVE-2016-10045.html
As version does not change between Ubuntu versions, trigger if the libphp-phpmailer package is installed but the version is not the patched build.

trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} vulnerable to CVE-2017-7494 (Samba)
trigger.description:
per https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2017/CVE-2017-7494.html add checks for package versions:
Ubuntu 17.10 (Artful Aardvark): released (2:4.5.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1) Ubuntu 12.04 ESM (Precise Pangolin): released (2:3.6.25-0ubuntu0.12.04.11) Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (Trusty Tahr): released (2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8) Ubuntu Touch 15.04: DNE Ubuntu Core 15.04: DNE Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Xenial Xerus): released (2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7) Ubuntu 16.10 (Yakkety Yak): released (2:4.4.5+dfsg-2ubuntu5.6) Ubuntu 17.04 (Zesty Zapus): released (2:4.5.8+dfsg-0ubuntu0.17.04.2)

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/share/doc/exim4-base/copyright].last()}=1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[dpkg --list | grep exim].str(4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4)}=0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2019-10149 (Exim RCE)
trigger.description: https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2019/CVE-2019-10149.html only 18.04 and 18.10 were affected. Suggest adding ubunut check for bionic at some future point.

trigger.expression: {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:vfs.file.exists[/usr/share/doc/exim4-base/copyright].last()}=1 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[dpkg --list | grep exim].str(4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5)}=0 and {Security Watcher For Public CVEs:system.run[dpkg --list | grep exim].str(4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4)}=0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME} Vulnerable to CVE-2019-15846 (Exim RCE)
trigger.description: https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2019/CVE-2019-15846.html Only take account of LTS releases. Check will need reworked on updated exim packages being released.
